result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M Schoolmaster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to his current sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed necessary.
DNA sample must be provided within 30 days.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY WOOD COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad M Schoolmaster

records.addlTxt: 10:14 AM Defendant Chad M Schoolmaster in court, in custody.  Jennifer C Zima appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears in court by telephone from the Adams County Jail. Attorney Slattery had to appear in a different hearing but has allowed us to move forward today with this hearing. Attorney Slattery requests to enter not guilty pleas, court grants. This matter will be set for a final pre trial. Bond is continued.

10:03 AM  Defendant Chad M Schoolmaster in court with attorney Travis S Slattery.  Defendant Chad M Schoolmaster in custody.  Daniel McGrath appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears in court by telephone. Attorney Slattery will stipulate to identification and continue with todays hearing.
Officer Abel is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being an Officer with the Marshfield Police Department. Testifies to conducting a traffic stop. Defendant was the driver of the vehicle. Testifies to finding syringes. Testifies to liquid in the syringes. Testifies to testing the liquid and the results. Testifies to the defendant stating what the liquid was.
Attorney Slattery cross examines witness. Witness testifies to the defendant being out of the vehicle when she was able to find it again. 
Attorney McGrath requests the court take Judicial Notice of another court case that is open.

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.
Bond is continued and this matter will be set for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
